Authors:
Shunsukh Nozawa, Katsuhiko Ando, Nyunt Phay, Watanabe
Kyoko
Title:
Neopestalotiopsis tanintharyina sp. nov.,
Pseudopestalotiopsis dawaina sp. nov., and Ps. kawthaungina sp. nov.:
three new species from Myanmar
Keywords:
ITS, β-tubulin, tef1, phylogenetic analysis, morphological
analysis, Pestalotiopsis-like
Abstract:
Pestalotiopsis sensu lato, which comprise the genera
Pestalotiopsis sensu stricto, Neopestalotiopsis, and
Pseudopestalotiopsis, form a taxonomic group originally called
Pestalotiopsis and share a common conidial morph. In this study, we
isolated three new species in this taxonomic group while performing a
survey of Pestalotiopsis s. lat. in Myanmar, a tropical area. We
performed molecular phylogenic analyses of these new species by using a
dataset that included sequences of the ribosomal internal transcribed
spacer (ITS) region and the β-tubulin and translation elongation factor
1-alpha (tef1) genes and classified one isolate as a member of the genus
Neopestalotiopsis and the other two isolates as members of
Pseudopestalotiopsis. Phylogenetic trees indicated that each isolate was
an independent species. Morphologically, the conidial traits of each of
the three strains did not coincide with those of any previously reported
species in the Pestalotiopsis sensu lato or Pestalotia genera.
Descriptions and illustrations of the new species obtained in this
study, Neopestalotiopsis tanintharyina, Pseudopestalotiopsis dawaina,
and Ps. kawthugina, are provided.
